meanings.definition: Capable of being anticipated or foreseen.
meanings.sent1: The upcoming test was anticipatable, so I studied hard.
meanings.sent2: It is anticipatable that the sun will rise tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The magician's anticipatable trick still amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her anticipatable success shone like a beacon in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's anticipatable smile welcomed the students every morning.

meanings.definition: Able to be expected or predicted.
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast was anticipatable, so I brought an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: An increase in sales was anticipatable after the new marketing campaign.
meanings.sent3: The anticipatable traffic jam made everyone late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: His anticipatable reaction to bad news was always calm and collected.
meanings.sent5: The anticipatable outcome of the experiment confirmed our hypothesis.
